snippet.title: Hi-Res Adventure #5: Time Zone for the Apple II
snippet.description:
Came also out for:

PC-88
PC-98


Game description:

Someone has chosen you to secure the Earth's future by destroying the evil ruler of the planet Neburon. He offers you the ability of time and space travel in order to do so, and has placed a time machine in your home so that you can travel to different time periods. In these periods, you will meet such famous names like Julius Caesar, Christopher Columbus, Cavemen, Robin Hood, Benjamin Franklin, and Cleopatra.

Like any other adventure game from On-Line Systems, you can switch between graphic and text modes. You are required to type a one- or two-word command to perform actions. The game can also be saved with a floppy disk, but with one that is specifically designed for use with the game.


What I think: 

I like it, it has an interesting concept. Sure, time travelling is not uncommon in video games, but for graohical text-adventures they rather are.

But it hard if you play it for the first time!
